Post-Match Reflections: Rich Hill recorded a clean eighth inning with two groundouts and a strikeout.
Hill has officially pitched in each of the last 20 major-league seasons, the only player to do so.
There’s a lot of people to thank, to get to this point,” he said as his voice trembled. “It’s special. Unfortunately, the biggest thing is we want to come away with the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Nick Sogard, called up Thursday as David Hamilton headed to the injured list with a fractured left index finger, was the only batter to record a hit off Francis through seven innings.
Danny Jansen’s single off reliever Genesis Cabrera produced the only other Red Sox hit on the night.
Crawford allowed two runs on six hits and two walks over 6 2/3 innings, marking his first start in the second half in which he recorded an out in the seventh inning.
With Hamilton sidelined for at least a few weeks after a pitch hit him on a bunt attempt Tuesday, the Red Sox have lost another key player.
Rafael Devers, though, who’s sat out the last three days with a sore shoulder, is expected to return to the lineup Friday and serve as designated hitter the next two days.
Liam Hendriks could rejoin the Red Sox as soon as next weekend with a fifth rehab outing scheduled for Friday with Triple-A Worcester.
Others: The Red Sox continue to face an uphill battle to reach the postseason.
The Red Sox moved to 3 1/3 games back of the Twins.
The good news for the Red Sox is that they’re headed back on the road where they’re 38-27 for the next six games against the Detroit Tigers and New York Mets.
